entry.title: CITY COUNCIL WITH VARIED AGENDA FOR MONDAY MEETING
entry.summary: October 23, 2023 3:30 a.m. The Roseburg City Council has a varied agenda for its Monday night meeting. Councilors will consider a resolution updating park rules and regulations. Current rules prohibit the distribution of any written or printed material in any city-owned park. Courts have determined that such distribution is protected under the U.S. Constitution...

entry.summary: October 23, 2023 3:20 a.m. Douglas County Commissioners Tom Kress, Chris Boice and Tim Freeman have announced that the new Douglas County Emergency Manager is Emily Ring. entry.title: PLANT CLINIC TO ACCEPT GARDENING QUESTIONS
entry.summary: October 23, 2023 3:00 a.m. Beginning November 1st, the Oregon State University Extension Service Master Gardener Plant Clinic will be open Mondays and Wednesdays from 1:00 p.m. to 4:00 p.m. The Plant Clinic is a free service to the public where master gardeners work to solve gardening questions from community members, using sustainable gardening practices....

entry.title: I Stand with Palestine rally, peaceful protest against genocide
entry.summary: The Palestinian flag waved in the breeze, among people holding hand-crafted signs reading phrases like, “I support a free Palestine, no more occupation,” at the I Stand with Palestine rally held Saturday.

entry.summary: 1827 — The religious order Sisters of Mercy was started by Sister Catherine McAuley.

entry.title: Oregon's original lighthouse still shines
entry.summary: Back in the 19th century, before there were interstate highways and logging trucks, commerce on the West Coast was largely conducted via waterways, especially rivers and the Pacific Ocean.

entry.title: HillCrest Vineyard aged like fine wine

entry.title: Nearly $50 million in grants to strengthen forest products economy
entry.summary: OREGON — The U.S. Department of Agriculture's Forest Service has nearly $50 million in grant funding available for proposals that will benefit forests, communities and local economies.

entry.title: Woman charged with murder denied pretrial release
entry.summary: Sierra Sioux Jennings, 29, was denied pretrial release and will remain at the Douglas County Jail for her alleged involvement in the murder of 34-year-old Joshua Lynn Alexander.

entry.title: From 'tin building' to destination resort

entry.title: Roseburg Rite Aid remains open
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — The Roseburg Rite Aid store on Northwest Garden Valley Boulevard is remaining open, with only one Rite Aid location in Oregon slated for closure, following the company’s filing for bankruptcy protection Sunday.

entry.title: Nonfarm payroll employment rises by 8,100 jobs in September
entry.summary: In September, Oregon’s seasonally adjusted nonfarm payroll employment rose by 8,100 jobs, following a revised decline of 700 jobs in August.
